qas.question: What was August von Hayek's occupation?
What was August von Hayek particularly passionate about?
From whom did Felicitas inherit her wealth?
How many children did August von Hayek and his wife have?

context: Friedrich August von Hayek was born in Vienna to <a0_0>August von Hayek<a0_0/> and Felicitas Hayek (née von Juraschek). Friedrich's father, from whom he received his middle name, was also born in Vienna in 1871. He was a <a1_0>medical doctor<a1_0/> employed by the municipal ministry of health, with passion in <a2_0>botany<a2_0/>, in which he wrote a number of monographs. August von Hayek was also a part-time botany lecturer at the University of Vienna. Friedrich's mother was born in 1875 to a wealthy, conservative, land-owning family. As <a3_0>her mother<a3_0/> died several years prior to Friedrich's birth, Felicitas gained a significant inheritance which provided as much as half of her and August's income during the early years of their marriage. Hayek was the oldest of <a4_0>three<a4_0/> brothers, Heinrich (1900–69) and Erich (1904–86), who were one-and-a-half and five years younger than him.
